name: Hampton Inn Phoenix Airport North

reviews.title: They gave my room away
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions prior to a flight since I live two hours from Phoenix. The family suite works well for my family of five. We got a late start from Prescott and arrived about 10:30 pm to find out that our "suite" had been given away and we were given a smoking room with two double beds instead. We thought we might tolerate the room for one night, but we could barely breathe. Even though I am a HiltonHonors Silver member and had reserved my room with a HiltonHonors American Express card, they gave away my room to someone who had arrived earlier. Since no other rooms were available, we ended up relocating to another hotel at 11:30 pm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel after reading reviews on this web site and because it's near the airport. We wanted to leave our rented car the evening before our flight and so we needed a complimentary shuttle from and to the airport.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: We checked in, left our luggage in the rooms and asked what we should do once we left the car. The reception gave us all the help we needed and also fixed the shuttle for the day after.
reviews.title: Excellent Hampton Inn

reviews.text: The rooms are very nice,clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Not bad - as airport hotels go

reviews.text: We didn't use the pool because we were too tired but considering the temperature outside it wouldn't have been a bad idea!
reviews.title: A suitable airport hotel

reviews.text: Stayed two nights at this hotel (Jan 6-7, 2006) and it was a very pleasant experience. The room was clean and inviting, the staff was very friendly, and the free breakfast was more than adequate. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Phoenix. Be sure to check out the Asian plaza directly across the street!
reviews.title: Great Hotel For Any Phoenix Visitor
Very near the airport
reviews.text: Good place to sleep. Best feature: near the airport. Pool was only reasonably clean. It was also heated to a very warm temperature. Expanded buffet was good. Like other Hampton Inns it features scrambled eggs shaped by a machine into pancake-like objects. Edible but no more than that. 44th street is very busy - ask for a quiet room if traffic noise is not your thing.

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.text: Stayed there 10/28 and 29th Room was very nice and reasonably prices Had a decent breakfast and very clean facuilty I have stayed in a lot more expensive hotels that was not nearly as nice. Room had mini fridge, micro, coffee pot along with a nice sitting area.

aka: Hampton Inn Phoenix Airport North Hotel Phoenix
description: We are the closest Hampton Inn hotel to Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, only half a mile north of the airport and we provide a 24-Hour Airport Shuttle for your convenience. We're adjacent to the Gateway Business Complex and the Chinese Cultural Center. Right near our hotel in Phoenix, you'll be able to enjoy everything from incredible golf to the nearby Camelback Mountains, Phoenix Zoo, Desert Botanical Garden, Papago Park, museums, excellent restaurants and more. In addition, we are only two blocks north from the Valley Metro Light Rail 44th Street Station. It’s only a 15 minute ride on the light rail to downtown Phoenix and downtown Tempe and many entertainment locations.
